title: Event Horizon buff
body:
http://imgur.com/1vVDf3e

**What's proposed.**
After the spell is cast (0.25 sec). Some fraction of the arc facing Veigar is instant. I think 30 degrees would be a nice starting point. Then the wall builds up around both ends simultaneously at a rate such that it reaches the back point in like 0.75 second. The wall lives for like 2 seconds or so. touching the wall stuns you the same way it does now.

**What's better about it**
Many stuns in this game have a trend where they are more reliable at close range, and harder to hit at long range. This allows Veigar to make defensive stuns while making offensive stuns still dodge-able. I think it would make trying to get out of the cage before it closes more interesting.

It might be harder to code, but hey, that's why you make the big bucks.

replies.body: I hope RiotRepertoir sees this.

I do see this, and I hope we can ultimately give some love to Veigar. I've seen quite a few Veigar threads that range from buffs to compromises to skill changes to identity shifts/affirmations, and I honestly don't know what the exact solution is. It probably makes sense to everyone that we shouldn't just try to do them all. If/when we do something for Veigar, I'd like it to be the right thing.

I don't really have a solution or any good news on this front right now, but it is something I would like to address.
He needs some way to reliably get divers out of his face, and some better ways to interact with enemies inside his cage who aren't stunned.

> [{quoted}](name=Squidblimp,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=xLYmdfnE,comment-id=000700000002,timestamp=2015-08-15T07:27:51.985+0000)
>
> He needs some way to reliably get divers out of his face, and some better ways to interact with enemies inside his cage who aren't stunned.

I strongly agree with both of these observations. The old edge-stun mechanic was annoying for all parties, but there was something flavorful about the panicky "land it or die" minigame. I think it's important that Veigar have some way to react to divers, and some way to nail down an enemy for a megaburst.

His cage needs *something* new that can tie his kit together the way the old stun did. I'm not even sure it has to stun anymore. Maybe it should be impassable terrain with some kind of weird effect inside it. I don't know. But I think most Veigar mains would have agree pre-rework that, while most people thought of his R as his "signature ability", in truth it was always his ragecage. Those few times he got played in LCS, the commenters astutely focused on his stun as his most significant aspect. It's what makes him unique as a Champion. It needs some love.

> Maybe it should be impassable terrain with some kind of weird effect inside it. I don't know.

if you wanna do that, make it a silence.  he's an anti-mage after all

The anti mage theme started decaying when he was introduced, every patch he lost things that gave him an edge on mages until the only thing he had was their AP ratios. He's not an anti mage, Kassadin was an anti mage. When he can be killed just as easily by them as they are by him, the identity begins crumbling, at this point in time after his horrendously shitty rework he is fodder for anyone with the slightest hint of dueling potential and a functioning brain to back it.

I would start by looking at his real weak link right now: W.  That's the spell you can change to really solidify his identity.

Past that, I'm not sure either.  But W's interaction with the new E is the source of Veigar's identity crisis in my eyes, so I think it's the best place to look at.

It probably makes sense to everyone that we shouldn't just try to do them all. If/when we do something for Veigar, I'd like it to be the right thing.
> 
> I don't really have a solution or any good news on this front right now, but it is something I would like to address.

On the one hand, I like that you're discussing Veigar so readily with the community. On the other hand, most of what I'm reading makes me want to grab the monitor and shake it violently while shouting, "NO! NO! WHAT IS WRONG WITH YOU? NO!" (Like, "Hmm, I think what people like about Veigar is that he's a Champion who can farm up a bunch, then just push one button and insta-kill an enemy!") So, kind of a mixed bag.

I don't have all the answers myself. But I think a good start would be to recognize that however miffed Riot was about Support Veigar taking over the Korean scene, Veigar **was a good Champion.** He had one of the most complex, multi-layered kits around, with lots of nuance. Sure, there wasn't that much to the EWQR combo, which is the first "trick" that one learned when playing Veigar. But you didn't get very far if all you did was wander around looking for someone to throw EWQR at. …I'm going to stop here before I go off on another rant. Suffice it to say that I've never seen a Champion with such an elegantly interconnected kit, with so much depth of strategy worked into it.

Really, I think it's about time for me to just stop playing Veigar and find some new Champions. I'd been meaning to do that for a long time. More than once, before the rework, I said, "okay, this is getting silly, you need to play some Champions who aren't Veigar." But…I had a hard time actually doing it. I kept going, "Well, sure, but…first, just a few more Veigar games, I think I'm really starting to figure him out." Perhaps I should take the rework as an unpleasant but necessary motivation to finally drop him and try other Champions.

So, in a sense, I'm not sure why I'm getting so worked up over these discussions, or wasting so much time I don't have posting in them. I mean, at this point, I'd probably agree to just about any change just to roll the dice again. It's not like it's going to make him worse than he is now.

I guess the frustration is that a lot of Rioters don't seem to understand how what they did in the post-DFG patch was not a "tweak" but a truly drastic rework. His stun, as stupid as the "land the edge" minigame was, nonetheless was the keystone for his entire kit. It informed every other skill he had. He is no longer the same Champion in any meaningful respect. I think that's where the frustration comes from: Riot does not seem to get how radical that change was. I wish I knew other Champions well enough to provide a good analogy. I don't know. Maybe like…yeah, I really can't come up with a good example. Maybe changing Cho'gath's Q from a delayed knock-up to an instant slow? That might be somewhat similar in how it would affect the rest of his kit.

**tl;dr: It's the stun. The problem is his stun. The old stun was the lynchpin of his entire kit. The make-or-break issue with new Veigar is how Riot is going to make his stun interesting, and more importantly, how his stun can be altered to have meaningful interactions with his other abilities and overall playstyle.**
As long as it isn't completely terrible to play against like the old stun, Veigar needs it.

As it was stated in another thread, I think finding his identity first is key, before any changes happen.  Personally, I appreciate the somewhat insane, megalomaniacal archmage with a height-complex.  His whole laning phase combined with his kit always felt like some sadistic game of chess with him pulling the strings; his cage really exemplifies this, almost like shooting fish in a barrel.  Whether or not he's moved towards identifying as a burst mage or antimage, I hope this part of his character remains intact, since that's what got me hooked on him back in s2.

Regarding the OP, I like this idea, the appearance of having the walls closing in on his target rather than coming out of nowhere fits the dominating angle of his megalomania much better, while giving him a fighting chance against assassins.  

+1 to you sir.

A buff would be a good start considering his pathetic win rate. Honestly I think he suffers from Syndra syndrome. His ultimate is too strong for him to ever be viable. Buff his basic abilities and he can 100-0 anyone. Miss 1 ability? You are useless. Vs an AD opponent? You are useless. He needs his lopsided power to be more balanced. More power for his basic abilities, less power more reliability in his ultimate.

... What's unreliable about his ultimate? It's a point-and-click damage spell. I mean, I guess you could argue that its damage scales off the enemy AP, but all that really means for head math is 'add 100-500 damage (depending on what my AP is at) if I get their mage.' If your target isn't the mage/AP hoarder, it deals 40-70% of the listed damage (depending on MR).

With its damage, it might be the most reliable ability in the game. 'Did I mouseover the AP carry when I used the spell? If yes, they're gone. If no, someone else is almost gone.'

Several ultimates are point and click and are stronger or offer utility. You answered your own question. His ult is pretty weak if the enemy has no AP, especially now that his W is easier to dodge, his kit has taken a massive hit. All of this after losing the deathfire grasp, the item that may as well have been made for Veigar.

He's been shoehorned into a feast or famine anti-mage ulting slave.

His W is completely out of place in his current kit.

Either change his W or make his E more reliable under certain scenarios (like this one where it's only a close range stun that is near instant)

I played literally thousands of Veigar matches before the rework. After the rework, it's almost physically painful to play him. He's so boring. I feel like he was remade by a bunch of people who'd never played or liked Veigar.

I'm not complaining that he's weaker. He might be, he might not be. He might well be stronger. But he's so incredibly boring now. And it really, really bothers me on an aesthetic level that his E is now a "stun" that only stuns people who *walk into the wall.* I hate the idea of an ability that only works if the enemy screws up—not makes a bad call, but actually screws up. There is no good reason to get stunned by Veigar anymore. When I do stun someone, I don't feel like I did anything right, so much as I feel like "well, guess I got matched against Wood Tier opponents. I feel bad for beating up on them."
